(51) 14324th May, 1951CABINETMINISTERIAL DUTIESNote by the Prime minister in CP. (51) 88 I set put the duties assigned to the Lord President (LordAddison) and the Lord Privy Seal (Mr. Bevin).2. Mr. Stokes, as Lord Privy Seal, will be responsible for the new MaterialsDepartment. In addition, he will retain his responsibilities in connection with the festival of Britain. I have therefore decided to reallocate as follows the dutiesassigned to his predecessor: (i) Information Services. The Secretary of State for Commonwealth Rela-tions will take over Ministerial responsibility for Home and overseas information Services, including responsibility for general questions ofpolicy affecting the Central Office of Information. He will be Chairmanof Cabinet Committees on Home and Overseas Information Services.(ii) Broadcasting and the Press. The Secretary of State for commonwealth relations will also assume responsibility for major questions of broad-casting policy and for general questions affecting the press.(iii) Socialisation of Industries. The Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancasterwill be Chairman of the Socialisation of Industries Committee; and inthis capacity will be responsible to the Cabinet for the co-ordinationof policy affecting the socialised industries and for promoting, in concert with the Departmental Ministers concerned, the efficient operation ofthose industries.(iv) Welsh Affairs. The Home Secretary will assume a general responsibilityfor the work of the Council of Wales and Monmouthshire.(v) Emergencies. The Home Secretary will resume the Chairmanship of theEmergencies Committee.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.WA,24th May, 1951
